intro: Epidendrum popayanense, commonly known as the Popayán orchid, is a species native to Colombia. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its erect, hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces inflorescences with numerous small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
